sen.j: 守邦親王（もりくにしんのう、正安3年5月12日 (旧暦)（1301年6月19日） - 正慶2年/元弘3年8月16日 (旧暦)（1333年9月25日））は、鎌倉幕府9代征夷大将軍で、鎌倉幕府最後の将軍である。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Morikuni (June 19, 1301-September 25, 1333) was the ninth seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and he was the last shogun of the Kamakura bakufu.

Imperial Prince Morikuni (June 19, 1301-September 25, 1333) was the ninth seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and he was the last shogun of the Kamakura bakufu.

Imperial Prince Morikuni (June 27, 1301- October 3, 1333) was the ninth seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and he was the last shogun of the Kamakura bakufu.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 8代将軍久明親王と、7代将軍惟康親王の娘の子として生れる。
sen.e: He was born to the eighth shogun, Imperial Prince Hisaaki and the daughter of the seventh shogun, Imperial Prince Koreyasu.
He was born to the eighth shogun, Imperial Prince Hisaaki and the daughter of the seventh shogun, Imperial Prince Koreyasu.
He was born to the eighth shogun, Imperial Prince Hisaaki and the daughter of the seventh shogun, Imperial Prince Koreyasu.

sen.j: 延慶 (日本)元年（1308年）8月、父の久明親王に代わってわずか8歳で征夷大将軍に就任した。
sen.e: In August 1308, he assumed the post of seii taishogun at the age of mere eight.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In August 1308, he assumed the post of seii taishogun at the age of merely eight.
In August 1308, he assumed the post of seii taishogun at the age of merely eight.

sen.j: 当時幕府の実権は執権の北条氏（中心は得宗家）が握っており、鎌倉将軍は名目的な存在に過ぎなかった。
sen.e: It was the Hojo clan (mainly the Tokuso family), a Shikken (shogunal regent) who took the real control of the bakufu then; the Shogun of Kamakura bakufu was just nominal.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It was the Hojo clan (mainly the Tokuso family), a Shikken (shogunal regent) who took the real control of the bakufu then; the Shogun of Kamakura bakufu was just nominal.
It was the Hojo clan (mainly the Tokuso family), a Shikken (shogunal regent) who took the real control of the bakufu then; the Shogun of Kamakura bakufu was just nominal.

sen.j: また、題目宗の是非を問う問答対決の命を亡き日蓮の六老僧の一人日朗（武蔵国長栄山池上本門寺住職）に下して居る。
sen.e: In addition, a dialogue for the need for Daimoku sect was assigned to Nichiro (a chief priest of Ikegami Honmon-ji Temple, Choei mountain, Musashi Province), one of the old six monks of Nichiren sect who passed away after that.

In addition, a dialogue for the need for the Daimoku sect was assigned to Nichiro (a chief priest of Ikegami Honmon-ji Temple, Choei mountain, Musashi Province), one of the six older monks of the Nichiren sect who passed away after that.

In addition, a dialogue for the need for the Daimoku sect was assigned to Nichiro (a chief priest of Ikegami Honmon-ji Temple, Choei mountain, Musashi Province), one of the six older monks of the Nichiren sect who passed away after that.

sen.j: 日朗は高齢ゆえに弟子日印を出し、文保2年（1318年）12月30日から翌元応元年（1319年）9月15日にかけて題目宗と日本仏教全宗派と法論を戦わせた（鎌倉殿中問答）。
sen.e: Nichiro was so old that he sent his pupil, Nichiin to have a debate between Daimoku sect and every other sect of Japanese Buddhism during the period from December 30, 1318 to September 15, 1319 (Kamakura denchu mondo Dialogue).

Nichiro was so old that he sent his pupil, Nichiin to have a debate between Daimoku sect and every other sect of Japanese Buddhism during the period from December 30, 1318 to September 15, 1319 (Kamakura denchu mondo Dialogue).

Nichiro was so old that he sent his pupil, Nichiin to have a debate between Daimoku sect and every other sect of Japanese Buddhism during the period from January 30, 1319 to November 5, 1319 (Kamakura denchu mondo Dialogue).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 結果、日印は仏教全宗派を論破し、幕府は題目宗の布教を正式に認める。
sen.e: After ll, Nichiin refuted all the sects of Buddhism, and the bakufu officially approved dissemination of Daimoku sect.
After ll, Nichiin refuted all the sects of Buddhism, and the bakufu officially approved dissemination of Daimoku sect.
After all, Nichiin refuted all the sects of Buddhism, and the bakufu officially approved dissemination of Daimoku sect.

sen.j: 元弘3年（1333年）、後醍醐天皇による鎌倉幕府打倒運動が起きると、鎌倉は足利義詮や新田義貞の攻撃により陥落。
sen.e: When a movement to topple the Kamakura bakufu by Emperor Godaigo in 1333 took place, Kamakura was fallen by the attacks by Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA and Yoshisada NITTA.
When a movement to topple the Kamakura bakufu by Emperor Godaigo in 1333 took place, Kamakura fell after attacks by Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA and Yoshisada NITTA.
When a movement to topple the Kamakura bakufu by Emperor Godaigo in 1333 took place, Kamakura fell after attacks by Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA and Yoshisada NITTA.

sen.j: 結果、鎌倉幕府は滅亡する。
sen.e: Eventually, the Kamakura bakufu was downfallen.
Eventually, the Kamakura bakufu was overthrown.
Eventually, the Kamakura bakufu was overthrown.

sen.j: 守邦親王は将軍職を辞して出家し、同年鎌倉で薨去した。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Morikuni resigned as shogun, and became a priest; he passed away in Kamakura in the same year.
Imperial Prince Morikuni resigned as shogun, and became a priest; he passed away in Kamakura during the same year.
Imperial Prince Morikuni resigned as shogun, and became a priest; he passed away in Kamakura during the same year.

sen.j: 官職位階履歴
sen.e: Career of job grade
Career job grade
Chronology of government posts and ranks

sen.j: ※日付＝旧暦
sen.e: *Date: in old calendar
*Date: in old calendar
Dates follow the lunar calendar.

sen.j: 延慶 (日本)元年（1308年）8月10日、征夷大将軍宣下。
sen.e: On August 10 in 1308, he was proclaimed as a seii taishogun.
On August 10 in 1308, he was proclaimed seii taishogun.
On August 10, 1308, he was proclaimed seii taishogun.

sen.j: 時に、守邦王。
sen.e: He was sometimes referred to as Morikunio.
He was sometimes referred to as Morikunio.
He was sometimes referred to as Morikuni-o.
sen.cmt: ハイフンを追加しました。

sen.j: 10月、立親王。
sen.e: In October, he became an imperial prince.
In October, he became an imperial prince.
In October, he became an imperial prince.

sen.j: 三品に叙せらる。
sen.e: He was appointed to Sanbon (the third rank of the Imperial Prince's ranks).
He was appointed to Sanbon (the third rank of the Imperial Prince's ranks).
He was appointed to Sanbon (the third rank of the Imperial Prince's ranks).

sen.j: 時に、守邦親王。
sen.e: He was sometimes referred to as Imperial Prince Morikuni.
He was sometimes referred to as Imperial Prince Morikuni.
He was sometimes referred to as Imperial Prince Morikuni.

sen.j: 文保元年（1317年）4月19日、二品。
sen.e: On April 19 in 1317, he was appointed to nihon (the second court rank for Imperial Princes).
On April 19 in 1317, he was appointed to nihon (the second court rank for Imperial Princes).
On April 19, 1317, he was appointed to Nihon (the second court rank for Imperial Princes).

sen.j: 元弘3年（1333年）5月22日、征夷大将軍辞職。
sen.e: On May 22 in 1333, he resigned as seii taishogun.
On May 22 in 1333, he resigned as seii taishogun.
On May 22, 1333, he resigned as seii taishogun.

sen.j: 出家。
sen.e: He became a priest.
He became a priest.
He became a priest.

tit.e: Shikken (shogun regent) when he served as shogun.
Shikken (shogun regent) when he served as shogun.
Shikken when he served as shogun
tit.cmt: 執権 既出のため、補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 北条師時（北条宗政の子。10代執権）
sen.e: Morotoki HOJO (a child of Munemasa HOJO. the tenth Shikken)
sen.cmt: B36を35にペーストしました。（本来一文であると思われるため）
sen.e: Morotoki HOJO (a child of Munemasa HOJO. the tenth Shikken)
